pullrequest.title: add code to set SimbodyCollision::collisionShape and SimbodyCollision::GetBoundingBox()

content.raw:
Oh, I see another problem with calcSupportPoint() -- it operates in the local
frame of the ContactGeometry shape. To use it for global directions, those
directions have to be transformed into the local frame first. So the current
implementation won't work correctly, even if all the methods are there. It
wouldn't be hard to make that transformation assuming we have access to
the body pose there and can get the ContactSurface's transform. But ... 
might be more practical to use the bounding sphere which is orientation-
independent (not to mention fully implemented!).

I also see now from the definition in the ContactGeometry base class that
calcSupportPoint() is only defined for convex shapes. That's why it didn't
get implemented for TriangleMesh, which isn't necessarily convex. But
I still think we should provide it for all shapes, since the bounding sphere
can always be used if nothing better is around.
content.html:
Oh, I see another problem with calcSupportPoint() -- it operates in the local frame of the ContactGeometry shape. To use it for global directions, those directions have to be transformed into the local frame first. So the current implementation won't work correctly, even if all the methods are there. It wouldn't be hard to make that transformation assuming we have access to the body pose there and can get the ContactSurface's transform. But ... might be more practical to use the bounding sphere which is orientation- independent (not to mention fully implemented!).

I also see now from the definition in the ContactGeometry base class that calcSupportPoint() is only defined for convex shapes. That's why it didn't get implemented for TriangleMesh, which isn't necessarily convex. But I still think we should provide it for all shapes, since the bounding sphere can always be used if nothing better is around.
